00024 # define ULIST_NTH(Const)                       \
00025   inline                                        \
00026   Const UValue&                                 \
00027   UList::operator[](size_t i) Const             \
00028   {                                             \
00029     i += offset;                                \
00030     if (i < size())                             \
00031       return *array[i];                         \
00032     else                                        \
00033       return UValue::error();                   \
00034   }
00035 
00036   ULIST_NTH(const)
00037   ULIST_NTH(/* const */)
00038 
00039 # undef ULIST_NTH
00040 
00041   inline
00042   size_t
00043   UList::size() const
00044   {
00045     return array.size();
00046   }
00047 
00048   inline
00049   void
00050   UList::setOffset(size_t n)
00051   {
00052     offset = n;
00053   }

00055   template<typename T>
00056   UList&
00057   UList::push_back(const T& v)
00058   {
00059     array.push_back(new UValue(v));
00060     return *this;
00061   }
00062

00064   UValue&
00065   UList::front()
00066   {
00067    return *array.front();
00068   }
00069 
00070   inline
00071   void
00072   UList::pop_back()
00073   {
00074     array.pop_back();
00075   }

00136   UValue::operator, (const UValue &b)
00137   {

00141 #  define CONTAINER_TO_UVALUE_DECLARE(Type)                     \
00142   template <typename T>                                         \
00143   inline                                                        \
00144   UValue&                                                       \
00145   operator, (UValue &b, const Type<T> &v)                       \
00146   {                                                             \
00147     b.type = DATA_LIST;                                         \
00148     b.list = new UList();                                       \
00149     for (typename Type<T>::const_iterator i = v.begin(),        \
00150            i_end = v.end();                                     \
00151          i != i_end; ++i)                                       \
00152     {                                                           \
00153       UValue r;                                                 \
00154       r, *i;                                                    \
00155       b.list->array.push_back(new UValue(r));                   \
00156     }                                                           \
00157     return b;                                                   \
00158   }
00159 
00160   CONTAINER_TO_UVALUE_DECLARE(std::list)
00161   CONTAINER_TO_UVALUE_DECLARE(std::vector)
00162 
00163 # undef CONTAINER_TO_UVALUE_DECLARE

00166 # define OP_COMMA(Type)        \
00167   inline                                        \
00168   UValue& UValue::operator, (Type rhs)          \
00169   {                                             \
00170     return *this = rhs;                         \
00171   }

00181 # define UVALUE_INTEGRAL_CAST(Type)                             \
00182   inline                                                        \
00183   UValue::operator Type() const                                 \
00184   {                                                             \
00185     return static_cast<Type>(static_cast<ufloat>((*this)));     \
00186   }

00192   inline
00193   UValue::operator bool() const
00194   {
00195     return static_cast<int>(static_cast<ufloat>((*this))) != 0;
00196   }

00206   inline
00207   std::ostream&
00208   operator<<(std::ostream& s, const UValue& v)
00209   {
00210     // Looks bizarre, but might happen without have the "print" die
00211     // (it *has* happened).
00212     aver(&v);
00213     return v.print(s);
00214   }

00223   // Run the uvalue_caster<Type> on v.
00224   template <typename Type>
00225   typename uvar_ref_traits<typename uvalue_cast_return_type<Type>::type>::type
00226   uvalue_cast(UValue& v)
00227   {
00228     return uvalue_caster<typename libport::traits::remove_reference<Type>::type>()(v);
00229   }
00230 
00231 
00232 # define UVALUE_CASTER_DEFINE(Type)             \
00233   template <>                                   \
00234   struct uvalue_caster <Type>                   \
00235   {                                             \
00236     Type operator() (UValue& v)                 \
00237     {                                           \
00238       return v;                                 \
00239     }                                           \
00240   };
00241 
00242   LIBPORT_LIST_APPLY(UVALUE_CASTER_DEFINE, URBI_NUMERIC_TYPES)
00243   UVALUE_CASTER_DEFINE(std::string);
00244   UVALUE_CASTER_DEFINE(const std::string);
00245   UVALUE_CASTER_DEFINE(bool);
00246   UVALUE_CASTER_DEFINE(UImage);
00247   UVALUE_CASTER_DEFINE(USound);

00249 #undef UVALUE_CASTER_DEFINE

00252   /*-----------------------------------.
00253   | Casting an UValue into an UValue.  |
00254   `-----------------------------------*/
00255 
00256   // Always return a const UValue&, a copy will be made if required.
00257 # define UVALUE_CASTER_DEFINE(Type)              \
00258   template <>                                   \
00259   struct uvalue_caster<Type>                    \
00260   {                                             \
00261     const UValue& operator()(UValue& v)         \
00262     {                                           \
00263       return v;                                 \
00264     }                                           \
00265   }
00266 
00267   UVALUE_CASTER_DEFINE(const UValue&);
00268   UVALUE_CASTER_DEFINE(UValue&);
00269   UVALUE_CASTER_DEFINE(const UValue);
00270   UVALUE_CASTER_DEFINE(UValue);
00271 # undef UVALUE_CASTER_DEFINE

00277   struct URBI_SDK_API uvalue_caster<UVar>
00278   {
00279     UVar& operator () (UValue& v);
00280   };

00283 # define UVALUE_CASTER_DECLARE(Type)            \
00284   template <>                                   \
00285   struct URBI_SDK_API uvalue_caster<Type>       \
00286   {                                             \
00287     Type operator () (UValue& v);               \
00288   }
00289 
00290   UVALUE_CASTER_DECLARE(UBinary);
00291   UVALUE_CASTER_DECLARE(UList);
00292   UVALUE_CASTER_DECLARE(UDictionary);
00293   UVALUE_CASTER_DECLARE(UObjectStruct);
00294   UVALUE_CASTER_DECLARE(const char*);

00296 # undef UVALUE_CASTER_DECLARE

00298 
00299 # ifndef UOBJECT_NO_LIST_CAST
00300 
00301 #  define UVALUE_CONTAINER_CASTER_DECLARE(Type)                 \
00302   template <typename T>                                         \
00303   struct uvalue_caster< Type<T> >                               \
00304   {                                                             \
00305     Type<T>                                                     \
00306     operator()(UValue& v)                                       \
00307     {                                                           \
00308       Type<T> res;                                              \
00309       if (v.type != DATA_LIST)                                  \
00310         /* Cast just the element.  */                           \
00311         res.push_back(uvalue_cast<T>(v));                       \
00312       else                                                      \
00313         for (size_t i = 0; i < v.list->size(); ++i)             \
00314           res.push_back(uvalue_cast<T>(*v.list->array[i]));     \
00315       return res;                                               \
00316     }                                                           \
00317   }
00318 
00319   UVALUE_CONTAINER_CASTER_DECLARE(std::list);
00320   UVALUE_CONTAINER_CASTER_DECLARE(std::vector);
00321 
00322 #  undef UVALUE_CONTAINER_CASTER_DECLARE
00323 
00324 # endif
00325 
00326   // Dictionary casters.
00327   template<typename V>
00328   struct uvalue_caster<boost::unordered_map<std::string, V> >
00329   {
00330     boost::unordered_map<std::string, V> operator()(UValue& v)
00331     {
00332       boost::unordered_map<std::string, V> res;
00333       if (v.type != DATA_DICTIONARY)
00334         throw std::runtime_error("UValue is not a dictionary.");
00335       typedef UDictionary::value_type DictVal;
00336       BOOST_FOREACH(UDictionary::value_type& val, *v.dictionary)
00337         res[val.first] = uvalue_cast<V>(val.second);
00338       return res;
00339     }
00340   };
00341   template<typename V>
00342   inline UValue&
00343   operator,(UValue& v, const boost::unordered_map<std::string, V> & d)
00344   {
00345     typedef typename boost::unordered_map<std::string, V>::value_type DictVal;
00346     v.clear();
00347     v.type = DATA_DICTIONARY;
00348     v.dictionary = new UDictionary;
00349     BOOST_FOREACH(const DictVal & val, d)
00350     {
00351       UValue nv;
00352       nv, val.second;
00353       (*v.dictionary)[val.first] = nv;
00354      }
00355      return v;
00356   }
00357 
00358   // Uses casters, must be at the end
00359   template<typename T>
00360   UList&
00361   UList::operator=(const T& container)
00362   {
00363     array.clear();
00364     typedef const typename T::value_type constv;
00365     BOOST_FOREACH(constv& v, container)
00366     {
00367       UValue val;
00368       val,v;
00369       array.push_back(new UValue(val));
00370     }
00371     return *this;
00372   }
00373   template<typename T>
00374   T
00375   UList::as()
00376   {
00377     T res;
00378     BOOST_FOREACH(UValue* v, array)
00379       res.push_back(uvalue_caster<typename T::value_type>()(*v));
00380     return res;
00381   }
